item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, October 12, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. AMD's Turin: 5th Gen EPYC Launched (145 points | 53 comments)
2. Electric vehicle battery prices are expected to fall almost 50% by 2026 (9 points | 5 comments)
3. Started a guide to writing FUSE filesystems in Python (193 points | 47 comments)
4. Build systems, not heroes (41 points | 37 comments)
5. Google is preparing to let you run Linux apps on Android, just like Chrome OS (86 points | 62 comments)
6. Lm.rs: Minimal CPU LLM inference in Rust with no dependency (241 points | 57 comments)
7. Conway's Gradient of Life (258 points | 20 comments)
8. The Society in Dedham for Apprehending Horse Thieves (14 points | 8 comments)
9. "Bad Apple" in Minecraft (257 points | 31 comments)
10. PeachPie Compiler: Compile and run PHP on top of .NET runtime (18 points | 2 comments)
11. The revival of the beach in twentieth-century Los Angeles (17 points | 3 comments)
12. How London's Crystal Palace was built so quickly (46 points | 14 comments)
13. MSI leaks Ryzen 9000X3D: 2% to 13% higher gaming performance than 7000X3D (13 points | 4 comments)
14. Show HN: I made a URL expander because short links are too mainstream (139 points | 63 comments)
15. Gboard double-sided version (14 points | 2 comments)
16. Working from home is powering productivity (426 points | 283 comments)
17. Windows dynamic linking depends on the active code page (111 points | 28 comments)
18. Switching customers from Linux to BSD because boring is good (8 points | 1 comment)
19. Show HN: Self-Hostable Algolia DocSearch Replacement (23 points | 9 comments)
20. Understanding the Limitations of Mathematical Reasoning in LLMs (196 points | 221 comments)
21. Show HN: I made an Ollama summarizer for Firefox (77 points | 23 comments)
22. Run Llama locally with only PyTorch on CPU (150 points | 29 comments)
23. Fundamental physics is dying? [video] (101 points | 140 comments)
24. Why do systems fail? Tandem NonStop system and fault tolerance (72 points | 26 comments)
25. Io_uring and seccomp (2022) (64 points | 19 comments)
26. INTELLECT–1: Launching the First Decentralized Training of a 10B Parameter Model (46 points | 10 comments)
27. "Begin disabling installed extensions still using Manifest V2 in Chrome stable" (417 points | 390 comments)
28. Are retrocomputers best left on or off? (46 points | 41 comments)
29. How long til we're all on Ozempic? (336 points | 1193 comments)
30. An exoskeleton let a paralyzed man walk, then its maker refused repairs (161 points | 119 comments)
